verses.verse: מַה־ <WH4100> mah- How יָּפ֧וּ <WH3303> ya-Fu beautiful פְעָמַ֛יִךְ <WH6471> fe-'a-Ma-yich are thy feet בַּנְּעָלִ֖ים <WH5275> ban-ne-'a-Lim with shoes בַּת־ <WH1323> bat- daughter נָדִ֑יב <WH5081> na-Div; O prince's חַמּוּקֵ֣י <WH2542> cham-mu-Kei the joints יְרֵכַ֔יִךְ <WH3409> ye-re-Cha-yich, of thy thighs כְּמ֣וֹ <WH3644> ke-Mo are like חֲלָאִ֔ים <WH2481> cha-la-'Im, [are] like jewels מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה <WH4639> ma-'a-Seh the work יְדֵ֥י <WH3027> ye-Dei of the hands אָמָּֽן׃ <WH542> 'am-Man. of a cunning workman

שָׁרְרֵךְ֙ <WH8326> sha-re-reCh Thy navel אַגַּ֣ן <WH101> 'ag-Gan goblet הַסַּ֔הַר <WH5469> has-Sa-har, [is like] a round אַל־ <WH408> 'al- never יֶחְסַ֖ר <WH2637> yech-Sar [which] wanteth הַמָּ֑זֶג <WH4197> ham-Ma-zeg; not liquor בִּטְנֵךְ֙ <WH990> bit-neCh thy belly עֲרֵמַ֣ת <WH6194> 'a-re-Mat [is like] an heap חִטִּ֔ים <WH2406> chit-Tim, of wheat סוּגָ֖ה <WH5473> su-Gah set about בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃ <WH7799> bash-sho-shan-Nim. with lilies

שְׁנֵ֥י <WH8147> she-Nei Thy two שָׁדַ֛יִךְ <WH7699> sha-Da-yich breasts כִּשְׁנֵ֥י <WH8147> kish-Nei [are] like two עֳפָרִ֖ים <WH6082> 'o-fa-Rim young תָּאֳמֵ֥י <WH8380> to-'o-Mei [that are] twins צְבִיָּֽה׃ <WH6646> tze-vi-Yah. roes

צַוָּארֵ֖ךְ <WH6677> tzav-va-Rech Thy neck כְּמִגְדַּ֣ל <WH4026> ke-mig-Dal [is] as a tower הַשֵּׁ֑ן <WH8127> hash-Shen; of ivory עֵינַ֜יִךְ <WH5869> 'ei-Na-yich thine eyes בְּרֵכ֣וֹת <WH1295> be-re-Chot [like] the fishpools בְּחֶשְׁבּ֗וֹן <WH2809> be-chesh-Bon, in Heshbon עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- By שַׁ֙עַר֙ <WH8179> sha-'ar by the gate בַּת־ bat- רַבִּ֔ים <WH1337> rab-Bim, of Bathrabbim אַפֵּךְ֙ <WH639> 'ap-peCh thy nose כְּמִגְדַּ֣ל <WH4026> ke-mig-Dal [is] as the tower הַלְּבָנ֔וֹן <WH3844> hal-le-va-Non, of Lebanon צוֹפֶ֖ה <WH6822> tzo-Peh which looketh פְּנֵ֥י <WH6440> pe-Nei toward דַמָּֽשֶׂק׃ <WH1834> dam-Ma-sek. Damascus

רֹאשֵׁ֤ךְ <WH7218> ro-Shech Thine head עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ <WH5921> 'a-La-yich crowns כַּכַּרְמֶ֔ל <WH3760> kak-kar-Mel, upon thee [is] like Carmel וְדַלַּ֥ת <WH1803> ve-dal-Lat and the hair רֹאשֵׁ֖ךְ <WH7218> ro-Shech of thine head כָּאַרְגָּמָ֑ן <WH713> ka-'ar-ga-Man; like purple מֶ֖לֶךְ <WH4428> Me-lech the king אָס֥וּר <WH631> 'a-Sur [is] held בָּרְהָטִֽים׃ <WH7298> ba-re-ha-Tim. in the galleries

מַה־ <WH4100> mah- How יָּפִית֙ <WH3302> ya-Fit How fair וּמַה־ <WH4100> u-mah- and how נָּעַ֔מְתְּ <WH5276> na-'Amt, and how pleasant אַהֲבָ֖ה <WH160> 'a-ha-Vah art thou O love בַּתַּֽעֲנוּגִֽים׃ <WH8588> bat-Ta-'a-nu-Gim. for delights

זֹ֤את <WH2063> zot likewise קֽוֹמָתֵךְ֙ <WH6967> ko-ma-teCh This thy stature דָּֽמְתָ֣ה <WH1819> da-me-Tah is like לְתָמָ֔ר <WH8558> le-ta-Mar, to a palm tree וְשָׁדַ֖יִךְ <WH7699> ve-sha-Da-yich and thy breasts לְאַשְׁכֹּלֽוֹת׃ <WH811> le-'ash-ko-Lot. to clusters

אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ <WH559> 'a-Mar-ti I said אֶעֱלֶ֣ה <WH5927> 'e-'e-Leh I will go up בְתָמָ֔ר <WH8558> ve-ta-Mar, to the palm tree אֹֽחֲזָ֖ה <WH270> 'o-cha-Zah I will take hold בְּסַנְסִנָּ֑יו <WH5577> be-san-sin-Nav; of the boughs וְיִֽהְיוּ־ <WH1961> ve-yih-yu- become נָ֤א <WH4994> na may שָׁדַ֙יִךְ֙ <WH7699> sha-Da-yich thereof now also thy breasts כְּאֶשְׁכְּל֣וֹת <WH811> ke-'esh-ke-Lot shall be as clusters הַגֶּ֔פֶן <WH1612> hag-Ge-fen, of the vine וְרֵ֥יחַ <WH7381> ve-Rei-ach and the smell אַפֵּ֖ךְ <WH639> 'ap-Pech of thy nose כַּתַּפּוּחִֽים׃ <WH8598> kat-tap-pu-Chim. like apples

וְחִכֵּ֕ךְ <WH2441> ve-chik-Kech And the roof of thy mouth כְּיֵ֥ין <WH3196> ke-Yein wine הַטּ֛וֹב <WH2896> hat-Tov like the best הוֹלֵ֥ךְ <WH1980> ho-Lech that goeth לְדוֹדִ֖י <WH1730> le-do-Di for my beloved לְמֵישָׁרִ֑ים <WH4339> le-mei-sha-Rim; [down] sweetly דּוֹבֵ֖ב <WH1680> do-Vev to speak שִׂפְתֵ֥י <WH8193> sif-Tei causing the lips יְשֵׁנִֽים׃ <WH3462> ye-she-Nim. grow old
אֲנִ֣י <WH589> 'a-Ni I am לְדוֹדִ֔י <WH1730> le-do-Di, I [am] my beloved's וְעָלַ֖י <WH5921> ve-'a-Lai and תְּשׁוּקָתֽוֹ׃ <WH8669> te-shu-ka-To. and his desire ס sa-Mek

לְכָ֤ה <WH1980> le-Chah Come דוֹדִי֙ <WH1730> do-Di my beloved נֵצֵ֣א <WH3318> ne-Tze let us go forth הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה <WH7704> has-sa-Deh, into the field נָלִ֖ינָה <WH3885> na-Li-nah let us lodge בַּכְּפָרִֽים׃ <WH3723> bak-ke-fa-Rim. in the villages

נַשְׁכִּ֙ימָה֙ <WH7925> nash-Ki-mah Let us get up early לַכְּרָמִ֔ים <WH3754> lak-ke-ra-Mim, to the vineyards נִרְאֶ֞ה <WH7200> nir-'Eh let us see אִם <WH518> 'im whether פָּֽרְחָ֤ה <WH6524> pa-re-Chah flourish הַגֶּ֙פֶן֙ <WH1612> hag-Ge-fen if the vine פִּתַּ֣ח <WH6605> pit-Tach appear הַסְּמָדַ֔ר <WH5563> has-se-ma-Dar, [whether] the tender grape הֵנֵ֖צוּ <WH5132> he-Ne-tzu bud forth הָרִמּוֹנִ֑ים <WH7416> ha-rim-mo-Nim; [and] the pomegranates שָׁ֛ם <WH8033> sham There אֶתֵּ֥ן <WH5414> 'et-Ten there will I give אֶת־ <WH853> 'et- דֹּדַ֖י <WH1730> do-Dai thee my loves

לָֽךְ׃ Lach. הַֽדּוּדָאִ֣ים <WH1736> had-du-da-'Im The mandrakes נָֽתְנוּ־ <WH5414> na-te-nu- give רֵ֗יחַ <WH7381> Rei-ach, a smell וְעַל־ <WH5921> ve-'al- and over פְּתָחֵ֙ינוּ֙ <WH6607> pe-ta-Chei-nu and at our gates כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- are all מְגָדִ֔ים <WH4022> me-ga-Dim, [are] all manner of pleasant חֲדָשִׁ֖ים <WH2319> cha-da-Shim [fruits] new גַּם־ <WH1571> gam- again יְשָׁנִ֑ים <WH3465> ye-sha-Nim; and old דּוֹדִ֖י <WH1730> do-Di for thee O my beloved צָפַ֥נְתִּי <WH6845> tza-Fan-ti [which] I have laid up לָֽךְ׃ Lach.
